comments: Also numbers n such that product of proper divisors is < n.A084114(a(n)) = 0, see also A084110. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 12 2003A109810(a(n)) = 2. [From _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 24 2010]A010051(a(n)) + A010055(a(n))*A064911(a(n)) = 1.A056595(a(n)) = 1. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 15 2011]See A050216 for lengths of blocks of consecutive primes. mathematica: nn = 223; t = Union[Prime[Range[PrimePi[nn]]], Prime[Range[PrimePi[Sqrt[nn]]]]^2] (* From T. D. Noe, Apr 11 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)a000430 n = a000430_list !! (n-1)a000430_list = m a000040_list a001248_list where   m (x:xs) (y:ys) | x < y = x : m xs (y:ys)                   | x > y = y : m (x:xs) ys-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 23 2011(PARI) is(n)=isprime(n) || (issquare(n,&n) && isprime(n)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 04 2013
